title: Job Openings at Fadac Resources and Services Limited
content:
Fadac Resources and Services Limited - Our clients in various sectors are currently recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the following positions below:

1.) Construction Site Builder

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview


	The Construction Site Builder is responsible for carrying out hands-on building activities on construction sites, including preparing, assembling, and installing structures.
	The role ensures work is performed according to plans, specifications, and safety standards while supporting project deadlines.


Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Execute building and construction tasks such as measuring, cutting, assembling, and installing materials.
	Interpret and follow blueprints, drawings, and site instructions.
	Operate hand and power tools safely and efficiently.
	Collaborate with site supervisors, engineers, and other workers to complete assigned tasks.
	Maintain site cleanliness and comply with safety regulations at all times.
	Identify and report site hazards, damages, or material needs promptly.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications.
	Proven experience in construction or similar role.
	Basic knowledge of construction methods, tools, and materials.
	Ability to read and interpret drawings/blueprints.
	Physical fitness and stamina to work outdoors and in varying conditions.
	Strong attention to detail and commitment to safety.


Application Closing Date: 25th October, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: emmanuel.o@fadacresources.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Talent Acquisition & Engagement Executive

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Responsibilities


	Working with Hiring Managers to identify staffing needs.
	Source for potential candidates through online channels (e.g., social platforms and professional networks)
	Screening and selecting suitably qualified candidates for different roles by conducting both phone and face-to-face/video interviews for prospective hires.
	Sourcing and engaging candidates for both immediate talent needs and the talent pipeline through various channels.
	Thorough screening of prospective hires through interviews.
	Ensuring a positive candidate experience and maintaining positive communication with prospective hires.
	Working with Line Managers to develop Job Descriptions for job roles, to aid hiring needs
	Working to drive traffic to the career portal continuously.
	Assigning candidates on the Career portal to a line manager for phone interviews.
	Leverage different channels to create and sustain employee dialogue towards engagement.
	Sourcing, screening, and selecting qualified candidates for all senior/top-level roles (or any other roles) by
	combining a range of methods (e.g., structured interviews, assessments, and behavioral questions).
	Attending job fairs and recruitment events.
	Participating in conferences and meet-ups to network with various professionals.
	Participating in exit interviews.
	Networking with potential candidates to promote the employer brand, attract professionals, and reduce hiring timelines.
	Plan interview and selection procedures, including screening calls, assessments, and in-person interview techniques.
	Periodically provide training and guidelines for assigned team member/s
	Monitor and ensure optimal performance of all recruitment activities and platforms, both at the front end (career portal) and back end.
	Provide a bi-weekly report of all unit members’ activities, as well as other required periodic reports.


Requirements


	A Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources Management or any other related field. Additional years of relevant experience may be substituted for a Degree.
	3 - 5 years of post-graduation experience with cognitive experience in full life-cycle talent acquisition.
	Excellent knowledge of MS Office.
	Additional qualifications and recognized professional certification (e.g., CIPD, CIPM, PHRi, SPHRi) will be a plus.
	Proven work experience as a Talent Acquisition Specialist or similar role.
	Familiarity with social media, resume databases, and professional networks (e.g., GitHub).
	Hands-on experience with full-cycle recruiting using various interview techniques and evaluation methods.
	Knowledge of Applicant Tracking Systems (ATSs).
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
	Demonstrated ability to utilize advanced and unique sourcing techniques to identify talent.
	Goal and result oriented with good leadership skills.
	Strong Strategic thinking and Problem-solving.


Application Closing Date: 30th September, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: susan.o@fadacresources.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Client Service Executive

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Description


	The ideal candidate will serve as the primary point of contact for clients, ensuring excellent service delivery, handling inquiries, and resolving issues promptly.
	This role requires strong communication, relationship management, and problem-solving skills to maintain and grow client satisfaction and loyalty.


Job Responsibilities


	Serve as the primary point of contact for client inquiries and requests, delivering timely and professional responses.
	Build and maintain strong, long-lasting client relationships.
	Ensure seamless communication between clients and internal teams to deliver on service expectations.
	Track client accounts and monitor service delivery to ensure agreed standards are met.
	Handle client complaints or issues effectively, escalating where necessary to achieve resolution.
	Prepare and deliver regular reports, updates, and presentations to clients as required.
	Support client onboarding processes, ensuring all requirements are properly documented and completed.
	Identify opportunities to upsell or cross-sell services to existing clients.


Job Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Communications, or a related field.
	2–3 years of experience in client service, account management, or customer-facing roles.
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
	Strong interpersonal and relationship-building abilities.
	Ability to manage multiple client accounts and tasks simultaneously.
	Proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and familiarity with CRM tools.
	Problem-solving mindset with strong attention to detail.
	A proactive, self-motivated, and customer-centric approach.


Application Closing Date: 29th September, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: susan.o@fadacresources.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
